ReviewList.Text: Definitely not a great physics book. Educational, but the information is scattered and not very thorough. It's a hard book to follow. Besides the book, the seller I bought from took almost two months to get the book to me, ended up not having it for the first two weeks of my class and fell behind. Will never buy from this seller again.

This book is totally counter-intuitive. It patronizes healthcare students in ways that are simply infuriating. For example, when presenting problems, they are phrased in order to pretend the physics applies to simple healthcare activities. One problem asks you to calculate the velocity of a falling aspirin tablet. What a useful thing to know in healthcare.

This was sold at a good price, was in pretty good condition for the price (I used a bit of binding tape on it just because I knew I would be using it a lot, but that was it), and has fantastic highlighting and notes - exactly what I needed!

The book condition was listed as, "like new" but this was far from the actual condition. The book had what I call "doggy ears" on the pages and many creases. While the book is still legible, the product did not match the description.
The purchase process was fast and satisfactory, and the book was mailed in time. I wish the seller would've described the condition of the book a little better. Other wise, it was a great experience.
It' ok but hasn't been updated in 25 years. My professor had to put updates in powerpoints in a few areas. Unless it is required I would probably take a Physics 101 course.
i found the book to be be very interesting! My professor didn't really teach from the health application part of the physics.
Just what I needed for my class
This is a great introduction to physics for medical majors. The book has been around over 20 years, so it has to be good.
Was fast and easy. Book came in condition is was described. Would buy from seller again.
